name: Airbnb
description: Airbnb brought consumers into the sharing economy with its revolutionary peer-to-peer travel marketplace. Today the company connects people around the world with its unique homes and unforgettable experiences.

name: Apple
description: Apple revolutionized personal technology with the Macintosh in 1984. It has repeatedly transformed the way humans interact with computers with the iPhone, iPod, MacBook, iMac and other products. Today it is the largest publicly traded company and one of the world’s most recognizable brands. Its forays into the worlds of cloud storage, wearables, music streaming and electric vehicles have proven the company continues to innovate.

name: Block
description: Bootstrapped by Jack, Square (now Block) had a vision to allow anyone with an iPhone to become a merchant. Part hardware, part app, the mobile payments product was originally called Squirrel because of its resemblance to an acorn.

name: Cisco
description: Cisco was one of the first companies to sell commercially successful routers for multiple network protocols. Today Cisco connects people, data and processes through its cloud-computing applications and services. Its hardware, software and services create the internet solutions that make networks possible.

name: DoorDash
description: DoorDash is a technology and logistics company that started with on-demand door-to-door delivery. It empowers local businesses to connect with people through their platform of diners and dashers.

name: Dropbox
description: Dropbox is a collaboration and storage platform transforming the way people and teams work together.

name: Google
description: Google founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin wanted to organize the world’s information. The result is Google Search, the world’s most popular way to find information online. Google’s products include email, maps, news, shopping, payment processing and more. Google continues to invest in an open web and new technologies that improve our way of life.

name: HubSpot
description: HubSpot does away with the needle-in-the-haystack approach to targeting consumers, allowing companies to manage marketing tools with one system. HubSpot offers training, analytics and advice to help companies master social media, use search engines and manage content aimed at the next generation of customers.

name: Instacart
description: Instacart is building the best way for people around the world to shop for groceries and get them delivered instantly. With its vast network of pre-existing grocers and drivers, Instacart offers tremendous inventory and convenience to customers. Its on-demand service is available in most major U.S. metropolitan areas.

name: Instagram
description: Instagram changed the way we share photos and video with mobile devices. It enables anyone to connect with more people, build a following and create compelling content that’s distinctly their own.

name: Linear
description: Linear helps developers streamline software projects, sprints, tasks and bug tracking without hampering progress.

name: Nubank
description: Nubank is the leading financial technology company in Latin America and the largest independent neobank worldwide, with more than 20 million clients. Initially a no-fee credit card managed by a mobile app, Nubank has since expanded to include a proprietary loyalty rewards program, digital account and personal loans.

name: NVIDIA
description: NVIDIA pioneered the art and science of visual computing. Its invention of the GPU transformed the PC from a tool for productivity into one for creativity and discovery. Enhanced visual graphics benefit everyone, from gamers and scientists to consumers and enterprise customers. NVIDIA is changing the way people work and play with modern technology.

name: PayPal
description: For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution, growing into a two-sided network that connects merchants and consumers in more than 200 markets worldwide.

name: Reddit
description: Reddit is the internet’s leading source of interest-based content. Subreddits devoted to every imaginable topic form a network of highly-specific, community curated information.

name: Retool
description: Retool is the fastest way to build internal applications. Instead of coding from scratch, Retool equips developers with the building blocks they need to make the basics and code the rest.

name: Snowflake
description: Snowflake powers the data cloud. It is a solution for all things data: warehousing, lakes, engineering, science, application development and sharing. It allows organizations to unite their siloed data, easily discover and securely share governed data, and execute diverse analytic workloads.

name: SpaceX
description: SpaceX designs, manufactures and launches the world’s most advanced rockets and spacecraft. The company is revolutionizing space transportation and developing a low latency, broadband internet system to meet the needs of consumers across the globe.

name: Stripe
description: Stripe is building an economic infrastructure for the internet. Businesses of every size, from new startups to public companies like Salesforce and Facebook, use the company’s software to accept online payments and run technically sophisticated financial operations in more than 100 countries.

name: Unity
description: Unity is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating interactive, real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Unity’s products equip content creators with the tools to entertain and create innovative RT3D experiences across most industries.

name: Vanta
description: Vanta automates and simplifies the complex, time-consuming and tedious process of becoming SOC 2-, HIPAA- or ISO 27001-compliant. It integrates and monitors tools and infrastructure, creates to-do lists for gaps, summarizes results, and connects users with a trained auditor.

name: WhatsApp
description: WhatsApp is an end-to-end encrypted mobile messaging app that lets users send messages free of charge. Acquired by Facebook in 2014, more than 2 billion people in over 180 countries now use WhatsApp to stay in touch.

name: YouTube
description: YouTube is the world’s leading video-sharing service. It makes uploading and sharing videos with family, friends and the entire world effortless. It was acquired by Google and is the web’s second most visited website.

name: Zoom
description: Zoom provides cloud video conferencing, online meetings, group messaging and a software-defined conference room on one easy-to-use platform. Its product brings teams together so they can connect to others and build toward a future limited only by their imagination.
